intro: Helicia loranthoides, commonly known as the parasitic honeycomb tree, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Theaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its woody structure and small, clustered flowers. The plant relies on host trees for water and nutrients, while producing its own carbohydrates through photosynthesis. Its unique appearance includes a dense, honeycomb-like bark and yellowish-green foliage. It plays a role in local ecosystems by influencing host tree growth and providing habitat for various insects.
